caption.p: Changes in precipitation characteristics for different precipitation intensities. a Difference in the number of wet days from the present climate for each category of precipitation intensity and b the cumulative precipitation amount. The value in a is normalised by the number of wet days in Present-DDS for every intensity category. Δ is the total change estimated by the DDSs (Future-DDS − Present-DDS). Δ P 0 and Δ C 0 indicate the contributions of the perturbation and climatology, respectively. Δ cp is the contribution of the nonlinear effect. The right scale in b indicates the ratio to the accumulated precipitation of the present climate (Present-DDS)
